item.title: Deep Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Today, we will explore Reinforcement Learning – a goal-oriented learning based on interaction with environment. Reinforcement Learning is said to be the hope of true artificial intelligence. And it is rightly said so, because the potential that Reinforcement Learning possesses is immense. Reinforcement learning refers to goal-oriented algorithms, which learn how …
item.dc:creator: Mohcine Madkour

item.title: The role of unit tests in test automation
item.description: Unit testing is a software development and testing approach in which the smallest testable parts of an application, called units, are individually and independently tested to see if they are operating properly. Unit testing can be done manually but is usually automated. Unit testing is a part of the test-driven …
item.dc:creator: Mohcine Madkour
item.guid: tag:mohcinemadkour.github.io,2017-08-03:/posts/2017/08/The role of unit tests in test automation/

item.title: Understanding Perfromance analysis with AUCROC, F1 Score, AUCPR values
item.description: The ROC curve is created by plotting the true positive rate (TPR) against the false positive rate (FPR) at various threshold settings. Each point of the ROC curve (i.e. threshold) corresponds to specific values of sensitivity and specificity. The area under the ROC curve (AUC) is a summary measure …
item.dc:creator: Mohcine Madkour
item.guid: tag:mohcinemadkour.github.io,2017-06-09:/posts/2017/06/Understanding AUC (of ROC), sensitivity and specificity values/

item.title: Clustering of vaccine temporal data in timeline
item.description: Events in clinical narratives are naturally associated with medical trials, including surgery, vaccination, lab test, medication, medical procedure, and diagnosis. They are interrelated with many temporal relations. The grouping of medical events onto temporal clusters is a key to applications such as longitudinal studies, clinical question answering, and information retrieval …
item.dc:creator: Mohcine Madkour
